contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he weighs people's actions" or "he understands why people act as they do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: by him actions are weighed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh breaks the bows of the mighty men" or "Yahweh can make even the strongest of people weak" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The bow of the mighty men are broken

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "nor had Yahweh ever revealed any message to him" or "and Yahweh had never revealed any message to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: nor had any message from Yahweh ever been revealed to him

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "there is no sacrifice or offering that anyone can offer that will atone for the sins of his house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the sins of his house will never be atoned for by sacrifice or offering

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the Philistines defeated the Israelites and killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Israel was defeated by the Philistines, who killed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Philistines have taken the ark of God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the ark of God has been taken

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "His neck broke because he fell" or "He broke his neck when he fell" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: His neck was broken

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Philistines had captured the ark of God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the ark of God was captured

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "Yahweh subdued the Philistines" or "Yahweh kept the Philistines from causing harm" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the Philistines were subdued

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "Yahweh restored to the land of Israel the towns ... from Israel" or 2) "the people of Israel were able to reclaim the towns ... from Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: The towns ... from Israel were restored to Israel

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the people had started to leave Saul" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the people were scattering from Saul

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "No one could find a blacksmith" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: No blacksmith could be found

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the music would refresh Saul and make him well" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Saul would be refreshed and well

contextId.information: A "coat of chainmail" is a flexible piece of body armor covered with protective scales or small plates. This can be stated in active form. AT: "he protected himself by wearing a coat of chainmail" or "he wore a coat of chainmail" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was armed with a coat of chainmail

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When the soldiers heard what David said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When the words that David said were heard

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when Saul should have given his daughter Merab to David" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when Merab, Saul's daughter, should have been given to David

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "to get revenge on the king's enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to be avenged from the king's enemies

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will not put him to death" or "I will not kill him" or "I will certainly keep him alive" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he will not be put to death

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Someone told Saul" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It was told to Saul

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When someone told Saul this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When Saul was told this

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he was grieving over David" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was grieved over David

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "we have kept ourselves from women" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: women have been kept from us

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "The men have set what belongs to them apart" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The things belonging to the men have been set apart

contextId.information: This is a statement, not a question. It can be translated in active form. AT: "It is especially true today that they will set apart what they have" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: How much more today will what they have be set apart

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "which the priests had removed from before Yahweh so that they could put" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: which was removed from before Yahweh, in order to put

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "for Yahweh had detained him there," perhaps so Doeg could finish doing something he had promised Yahweh he would do (see UDB) or 2) no one knows why he was there, "for some reason" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: detained before Yahweh

contextId.information: Saul was most interested in David, so the writer mentions the other men separately. This can be translated in active form. AT: "someone had discovered where David and all the men who were with him were hiding" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: David had been discovered, along with the men who were with him

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "Someone told Saul" or "They told Saul" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Saul was told

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "Someone told Saul" or "They told Saul" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It was told Saul

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "I hope that Yahweh blesses you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May you be blessed by Yahweh

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "People tell me" or "I have heard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It is told to me

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "someone told him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was told

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) David will cause the kingdom of Israel to prosper through his power as king. AT: "the kingdom of Israel will prosper as you rule the Israelite people" or 2) Yahweh will cause David to have complete control over the kingdom of Israel. AT: "you will have complete rule over the kingdom of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the kingdom of Israel will be established in your hand

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that Nabal had said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that was said

contextId.information: The speaker is careful not to name the one plotting the evil. This can be translated in active form. AT: "someone is plotting to do evil things to our master" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: evil is plotted against our master

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "no one will ever see you do any evil thing" or "you will never do anything evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: evil will not be found in you

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) "I praise Yahweh ... who" (UDB) or 2) "May all people praise Yahweh ... who." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May Yahweh ... be blessed, he who

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "I would not have left to Nabal even one male baby" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: there would certainly have not been left to Nabal so much as one male baby

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:1sa:25:32|25:32]]. Possible meanings are 1) AT: "I praise Yahweh" (UDB) or 2) AT: "May all people praise Yahweh"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May Yahweh be blessed

contextId.information: The abstract nouns "cause" and "insult" can be translated as verbs. Possible meanings are 1) AT: "has shown that what I was doing was right by punishing Nabal for insulting me" or 2) AT: "has acted, when Nabal insulted me, as if Nabal had insulted him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: has taken up the cause of my insult

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "May Yahweh bless you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May you be blessed

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "they saw that someone had burned it and taken their wives ... captive" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it was burned, and their wives ... daughters were taken captive
